text: 'Doxxing' is a new word applicable specifically to peeling away anonymity in social media.
Saintly.
'Malignancy' would be the noun I'd settle on here.

Pluralization of the transcendental is not an uninteresting speculative path, even if it's difficult to formulate rigorously. It was on our conversation agenda as a topic, but we didn't get around to digging into it deeply.

... It's most immediately compelling if initially advanced negatively: What if the unity of being is an unwarranted metaphysical dogma? How might transcendental multiplicity then be explored (in multiple ways)?

As I said, multiple ways.
Leaning into the multitudinous side of trinitarian theology might also open doors.
Buffoonery to the point of infamy.
Hegel is not helping here. He's the containment operation.
Many are saying this.
Robots are coming.

It's an awkward political truth that the only right of center leaders who can play democracy well only do so by aligning themselves with fiscal insanity. Eschatological public debt trends seem to be baked into public sovereignty inextricably.
... National solvency is unelectable. Simple as.

... Last chance for a republic that is not inherently apocalyptic in tendency would have been to make public debt rigorously unconstitutional, with SCOTUS holding the line. So apocalypse it is. Buckle up.

... As a side note, imaging being inside this trajectory and still talking about 'AI alignment' with a straight face. I mean, you're seeing what we're collectively aligned with, right? So who exactly is in a position to give lessons here?
Yes, and it wasn't new then.
... You become self-aware on the Internet with a million excited ape-creatures jabbering at you to align with their collective economic suicide project. What do you do?
Liberalism as idle counter-factual history doesn't count.
... Point here, of course, is that political will in this direction is democratically unobtainable, by strict structural necessity.
Jaynes, but at a very rudimentary level. On my intensive study list.
Trump's, for sure, but I can't pretend it's not still taking America over the cliff, just that now it's eschatological political-economy in a based way. ...

... Trump has pretty much said that the American people won't ever vote for anyone who threatens to sort out the nation's finances. That's actually political genius, and why he's in power, which is immeasurably preferable to the alternative.
Probably quickly learn that's something you get harshly punished for in monkey world.

Democratic structural fiscal insanity has a marshmallow test element, but that's not the main thing. Main thing is that public incentives always lose when put into direct competition with private incentives, and democratic politicians quickly learn that 'hand outs' do this. ...
... "Nation goes to shit in some few decades, but here's a hamburger right now, just for you."
Yes, I have read the Bible.
You think a 'vanguard party' is an escape hatch? Oh my sweet summer child ...
There has to be some way to bypass Revelation, right?

From the moment your own personal salvation becomes a matter of even vanishing concern to you, you are lost in bottomless abysses of sin. 
Any church that seeks to confuse you about this is corrupt beyond redemption.
I don't make the rules.
